title: Design for Printed Textile-"Jacks," "Seeds," "Trispot,"
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
medium: Pen and black ink, graphite on heavy white tracing paper
description: Four examples of textile designs arranged on one sheet. Two versions of "Jacks," one group arranged tightly and one arranged loosely.  One group of "Trispot," consisting of a pattern of thre small dots; and on group of "Seeds," ovoid shaped with white centers.  Each design group is placed on a graphite grid.
name: Drawing
